title: Is there a platform where you can write books online and start earning money straight away? - Quora

response.answer_text: Get paid to write from home. I have compiled this list of 10+ websites that will pay you to write articles, short stories, fiction, poetry, features and articles from home. A Huge List of Websites That Pay You To Write For Them There are so many websites and publications out there that will pay you to write so I’ve grouped them into the following categories to make it easier to navigate: Write Fiction, Short Stories and PoetryShare your personal storiesWrite Non-Fiction articles and blog posts1.The People’s Friend The People’s Friend have helpfully provided a tips sheet on each type of piece they’re looking for from short stories to pocket novels.. Pay: How much you will get paid to write for them depends on how long you’ve been writing for The People’s Friend. New writers start at £80 but move up to £110 after 6 successful submissions. It’s £150 for each instalment of a serial. Pocket novels and “long reads” – £300. Poems – £15 per poem. 2.One Story One Story is looking for literary fiction and accepts and pays for stories between 3,000 and 8,000 words. Pay: $500 3. Zizzle Zizzle will pay you to write fiction that appeals to kids from age 11 through to adults. The length of the story should be between 500 and 1,200 words. Pay: $100 for each accepted flash fiction piece. 4.The Arcanist The Arcanist will pay you to write micro stories. Pay: $10 for 100 words. 5.Flash Fiction Online Flash Fiction online accept original fiction between 500 and 1,000 words long. Pay: $60 per story for original fiction. 6.Craft Literary Craft publish new and republished fiction, critical pieces on craft, interviews, book annotations, and much more. Pay: They pay their authors $100 for original flash fiction and $200 for original short fiction. 7.The Sun Magazine The Sun Magazine is looking to pay writers for non-fiction pieces, fiction and poetry. Pay: Non-fiction – $300 to $2,000 Fiction – $300 to $2,000 Poetry – $100 to $250 8.Fireside Magazine Fireside Fiction Company is a short-story magazine. They have a goal of publishing great stories regardless of genre. Pay: 12.5 cents per word. For illustrations, they pay $400 for a full-colour piece. 9.Asimov’s Science Fiction Asimov’s Science Fiction magazine publishes science fiction stories. They tend to pay for stories that are between 1,000 words and 20,000 words. While poetry should not exceed 40 lines. Pay: 8-10 cents per word for short stories up to 7,500 words, and 8 cents for each word over 7,500. They pay $1 per line for poetry. Reader’s Digest Send the world-famous Reader’s Digest a true story about you, in 100 words or less. 10.Pay: $100. Readers Digest Asia Readers Digest Asia have a couple of categories where they are looking for writers: inspiring stories or life-changing experiences – 800-1,000 words, they pay $250 for published stories acts of kindness – 100-500 words, pay up to $100 anecdotes and jokes – pay $50 – 100 tales of your amazing animals – up to 300 words, pay up to $100 Bella Magazine Share your personal story with Bella Magazine and earn up to £1,000. Send them a brief outline and someone from the Bella features team will contact you to check the details. Or you could share your views in a letter and win £50 if you’re chosen as the star letter. If you’re looking to make money from home and you love to write then this could be a brilliant side hustle. Please comment below and I can add any good ones to the list.

One of the easiest ways to sell ebooks is to work through a third-party site like Amazon. You may have ordered products, even books, from Amazon in the past. But this is a whole different side to this massive e-commerce site. The big benefit of working through Amazon Kindle Direct Publishing, even though they charge you a commission on your sales, is their reach. Around 89 million Americans are said to be active ebook readers. That’s your potential audience, all those people visiting this site and browsing for a new book. It could be your book they find when searching for a related keyword. 38 percent of daily sales of ebooks on Amazon go to self-published titles. While you may not make as much money as you would selling directly on your site, you'll have the opportunity to reach an audience that you wouldn't otherwise have access to. The process of selling your ebook on Kindle is straightforward. You sign up, then upload your ebook. They take care of converting it to their proprietary format. Then you’re ready to sell and grow your business through Online Shopping for Electronics, Apparel, Computers, Books, DVDs & more.

You can write books on several platforms — Amazon, Smashwords, Barnes and Noble, Kobo, Google Play. Most pay 60 days after the end of a month, into a bank account. The exception is Smashwords, which deposits funds into PayPal. As you likely know, income is not automatic. You need to write a good book on a topic that interests a lot of people, and you need to promote it. If you write a how-to publication, sometimes that generates income faster. People “need” the information. Though I write primarily fiction, no one “needs” to buy fiction. You can check out my blog for some ideas on publishing and marketing — there is an index. Good luck! Elaine L. Orr http://elaineorr.blogspot.com

No. There are platforms where you can post your books online and eventually maybe make a little bit of money, but all these depend on hard work on your end, which always involves seeking out people who are willing to be your paying customer. You have to get readers the hard way. Nobody is going to walk up and ask to be your fan. You can, of course, get paid upfront publishing stories with some magazines, but the publications that will actually pay you are rare and hard to find these days and I wouldn’t call them a platform, and the content they want usually isn’t as long as a “book”. Please be aware of scams where people try to get you to sign away your intellectual property for pennies. And then, after you have signed it away, you find out that you still have to get readers the hard way, same as anybody else. Watch out especially for startup platforms. Read the terms of service.

Can you start earning money immediately by self-publishing your books? I’ve seen some good answers to this question, and the best of them all boil down to: no. If you could do so, everyone would quickly follow suit. And, I’m not sure you understand the logistics involved here, but if everyone followed suit, no one would be able to find your book to buy. It would be awash in a proverbial sea of literature. The bottom line is this: If you want to be a writer, take the time to learn how to do it right and be a writer. That means months, years, or even decades of learning, practicing, publishing, building a following, failing, and succeeding. If you want to be an entrepreneur, don’t turn to writing for your salvation. Can you be a writer and an entrepreneur? Possibly. At least some people have shown an ability to write books and market them effectively. But that begs the question: Which are they? Writers or marketers? Artists or entrepreneurs? I’ll leave that to you to answer. Hope this helps.

But, you must own a PayPal account that can receive money or you'll be paid in amazon gift cards I think... So useless if you ask me. Moboreaders is different. Readers pay to read locked chapters and you recieve monthly payments to an account of your choice. (you will state this account in the contract.) Good luck
